TECHNIQUE.name: File download (Rudder server)
TECHNIQUE.DEPRECATED: This technique version has been superseded by a new version. It will no longer be available in the next stable version of Rudder. Please upgrade to the latest version.
TECHNIQUE.DESCRIPTION:
This technique downloads a file from Rudder server.
It ensures that some files are the copy of files on the shared folder of the Rudder Root Server, and optionally allows running a command in case a change was made.

INPUT.NAME: COPYFILE_NAME
INPUT.DESCRIPTION: Relative path of the source file
INPUT.LONGDESCRIPTION: This is path of the file/folder to be copied on the Rudder policy server relative to /var/rudder/configuration-repository/shared-files

INPUT.NAME: COPYFILE_DESTINATION
INPUT.DESCRIPTION: Full path of the destination file or directory (WARNING: if the source is a file, the filename must be included)
INPUT.LONGDESCRIPTION: This is the absolute path of the file/directory on the managed node. If you are copying a file, the destination path needs to contain the destination filename. The permissions defined below will be applied on the whole content of the destination, including files that were not copied.

SELECT1.NAME: COPYFILE_EXCLUDE_INCLUDE_OPTION
SELECT1.DESCRIPTION: Exclude or include files from the copy
SELECT1.LONGDESCRIPTION: Limit list of files to copy (include) or don't copy some files matching a pattern (exclude). Only applies if the path to copy from is a directory.

INPUT.NAME: COPYFILE_EXCLUDE_INCLUDE
INPUT.DESCRIPTION: File name patterns to exclude or include
INPUT.LONGDESCRIPTION: If one or several files should be excluded or included in this copy, please insert their name or a regular expression matching the appropriate file name(s))

ITEM.LABEL: Folder content and all the subcontent

SELECT1.NAME: COPYFILE_PURGE
SELECT1.LONGDESCRIPTION: If this is enabled, all other content than the source in the destination directory will be purged.

SELECT1.NAME: COPYFILE_COMPARE_METHOD
SELECT1.LONGDESCRIPTION: This is the method to use for comparison between source and destination files. - "mtime" copies the file if the modification time of the source file is more recent than that of the promised file. - "ctime" copies the file if the change time of the source file is more recent than that of the promised file. - "atime" copies the file if the access time of the source file is more recent than that of the promised file. - "exists" copies the file if the promised file does not already exist. - "binary" copies the file if they are both plain files and a byte-for-byte comparison determines that they are different. If both are not plain files, the agent reverts to "digest". - "digest" copies the file if they are both plain files and a MD5 message digest comparison indicates that the files are different. The "digest" option is set by default but may offer poor performance on large numbers (over 100) of file copies - in that case use "mtime" instead.

INPUT.NAME: COPYFILE_OWNER
INPUT.DESCRIPTION: File or whole direcotory content owner

INPUT.NAME: COPYFILE_GROUP
INPUT.DESCRIPTION: File or whole direcotory content group

INPUT.NAME: COPYFILE_PERM
INPUT.DESCRIPTION: File or whole direcotory content mode

INPUT.NAME: COPYFILE_SUID
INPUT.LONGDESCRIPTION: Note: The SetUID and SetGID bits will not be applied recursively, for obvious security reasons.

INPUT.NAME: COPYFILE_SGID
INPUT.LONGDESCRIPTION: Note: The SetUID and SetGID bits will not be applied recursively, for obvious security reasons.

INPUT.NAME: COPYFILE_STICKY_FOLDER
INPUT.DESCRIPTION: Sticky bit for folder (caution, use with care)
INPUT.LONGDESCRIPTION: If set, and the path is a folder, and recursion is set to "Folder content", apply on folder (won't apply to subfolders, for obvious security reasons).

INPUT.NAME: COPYFILE_POST_HOOK_RUN
INPUT.LONGDESCRIPTION: Should the command(s) below be run if any modifications (permission or overwriting) are made on the files above?

INPUT.NAME: COPYFILE_POST_HOOK_COMMAND
INPUT.LONGDESCRIPTION: List of shell-compatible statements to be executed. Multiple commands may be specified on separate lines.
